Articles.Content:
I was running a successful mission until the ship took a mind of its own and so I had to react quick and I spammed space to get the Kerbals home safe to their family\'s ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). And it turned out to be a huge mistake ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Here is my space minefield ???:

![7192488238_010c877125_c.jpg](http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8148/7192488238_010c877125_c.jpg)

Is the debris on some reentry course? 

Yes) Accidental MIRV, innovation whether you like it or not.

No) A challenge! Never tell me the odds.
Dont worry,all of that is going to drift apart and you likely wont hit it =P
You may have to watch your launch window from now on... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
66 Kilometers, 1000 M/S.. I\'ll say that\'s a re-entry course. LOOK OUT BELOW!

> 
> 66 Kilometers, 1000 M/S.. I\'ll say that\'s a re-entry course. LOOK OUT BELOW!

Ya I think they crashed a few hours from the pic (in-game) but you would be a bit pissed if it landed in your garden ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

A local council in West Australia fined NASA for $400AUD for littering when Skylab came down.

True story

> 
> A local council in West Australia fined NASA for $400AUD for littering when Skylab came down.
> 
> True story

Well this is going to bankrupt me with all this junk ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Yer gonna need glue! Lots of glue!

Hmm... Time for my new picture

> ![rouHl.png](http://i.imgur.com/rouHl.png)
I crashed into debris only two times. One time with a plane at sea level and one time while pushing a failed test lander around. Ended deadly both times.
